title: Court Overturns $464M Fine Against Trump in Fraud Case, Upholds Other Sanctions
snippets: Trump, in a social media post, claimed "total victory" after the ruling, which spares him from a potential half-billion-dollar fine for decades of exaggerating his wealth.
In its 323-page ruling, the New York judges stated that the fine was excessive, and likely violated the US Constitution.

A New York appeals court has ruled that US President Donald Trump will not be required to pay a $515 million (around €443 million) civil fraud penalty, eliminating one of his biggest financial liabilities.

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMigwFBVV95cUxOQ24xSk9ONUdRVGh4T1NlNXdWUFVta3R2YWdlalExb2Z4SWpNOXJvN2FvbEdocjBSeElPc0J5Vm5VRGpqWEhTeDlrallRakI1LUVJbG50X2J6UC0tR1R1M0ZoUnRVZzMwaXFRZ3Zwc2JVeGZOUGZsbW56RVpQeVpNR3dIRQ?oc=5" target="_blank">President Trump's massive civil fraud penalty jus
A New York appeals court has thrown out the half billion-dollar civil fraud judgment handed down last year against President Trump, his family and his company.
Ruling marks a victory for the president in one of his remaining legal headaches after return to the White House

Divided decision by New York appeals judges dismisses ‘excessive’ penalty but leaves room for further appeals

A New York appeals court has thrown out the massive civil fraud penalty against
titles: An appeals court throws out a massive civil fraud penalty against President Trump
Appeals court throws out Trump's $500m civil fraud penalty
US court throws out massive fraud penalty against Trump
President Trump's massive civil fraud penalty just got tossed out - Axios
WATCH:  NY appeals court throws out civil fraud judgment against Trump
New York appeals court overturns $500mn penalty in Trump fraud case
Court throws out $500m civil fraud penalty against Donald Trump
summary: A New York appeals court has overturned a $464 million fine against President Donald Trump in a civil fraud case, deeming it excessive and likely a violation of the US Constitution. The case, filed by New York State Attorney General Letitia James, accused Trump of inflating his assets to secure favorable terms from lenders and insurers. While the court dismissed the financial penalty, it upheld other sanctions against Trump, his family, and his company. This decision represents a significant legal victory for the President amidst ongoing legal challenges.

title: Supreme Court Backs Trump Admin in Cutting DEI-Linked Grants
snippets: But the court, in its emergency docket order, also left in place by a 5-4 order a lower court ruling that threw out NIH memos that enforced the administration's policies.
SCOTUS decision impacts DEI programmes that include breast cancer research and HIV prevention.
Supreme Court sides with Trump on cutting government grant programs involving diversity, equity and inclusion.
The decision could result in the loss of National Institutes of Health grants worth hundreds of millions of dollars.
titles: Supreme Court allows NIH to stop making nearly $800M in research grants for now
US Supreme Court rules Trump admin can cut nearly $800m in health funding
Supreme Court says Trump may cancel DEI-related health research grants
Supreme Court Allows Trump To Cut Millions In DEI-Related Health Grants
summary: The Supreme Court, in a 5-4 decision, sided with the Trump administration to cut government grant programs that involve diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI), impacting areas such as breast cancer research and HIV prevention. This ruling upheld a lower court's decision to invalidate National Institutes of Health (NIH) memos enforcing these policies, potentially leading to the loss of NIH grants worth hundreds of millions of dollars.

title: Jaylen Brown's Father Charged with Attempted Murder in Las Vegas
snippets: The father of Boston Celtics star Jaylen Brown was accused of attempted murder in connection with a stabbing Wednesday night in Las Vegas.
Quenton M. Brown allegedly stabbed a youth football coach after arguing over a parking incident

The father of Boston Celtics All-Star Jaylen Brown was arrested in Las Vegas and charged with attempted murder after reportedly stabbing another man in a parking lot.
titles: Father of Celtics' Brown arrested after stabbing
Father of Celtics' Jaylen Brown arrested for attempted murder following alleged stabbing in Las Vegas
Marselles Brown, Father of Celtics Star Jaylen Brown, Arrested for Attempted Murder - Sports Illustrated
AP Source: Father of Celtics’ Jaylen Brown arrested in Las Vegas
summary: Quenton M. Brown, the father of Boston Celtics star Jaylen Brown, was arrested and charged with attempted murder in Las Vegas. The charge stems from an incident where he allegedly stabbed a youth football coach following an argument over a parking situation.

title: Judge Disqualifies Trump Lawyer Alina Habba from Case Over Appointment Issue
snippets: The Trump administration has ignored a July decision from a panel of judges replacing Habba as interim US attorney.

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMiiwFBVV95cUxPRDg5TlZvRjFPV0tfQWJmVFZFSDRub09JX045QV92bzN3WHFUZlJMWW9Fa2R5SXFnQ0FGd1BJYWZrUlFaLVdsZmpiaTNvUHZlalVmQjhIRVowREFmWmFZUXpkSHFvNGpLbEJ2eGVEVnY4VmQxU0FpM29wcnpObVJwanNEaTlBckRrbWVv?oc=5" target="_blank">Alina Habba "unlawfully appointed" New
Alina Habba, who has served as the acting U.S. Attorney for New Jersey, is a former lawyer for President Donald Trump.
The judge disqualified the former Trump lawyer from overseeing a case against criminal defendants who challenged her authority.
titles: Judge rules Trump lawyer Alina Habba is unlawfully serving as US attorney
Alina Habba "unlawfully appointed" New Jersey AG, federal judge rules - Axios
Judge says Alina Habba, Trump's top federal prosecutor in New Jersey, not lawfully appointed
Judge Strikes Down Alina Habba’s Authority As U.S. Attorney
summary: Alina Habba, previously a lawyer for Donald Trump and acting as the U.S. Attorney for New Jersey, was disqualified by a judge from overseeing a case. This decision came after criminal defendants challenged her authority, citing her appointment as "unlawful." The Trump administration has not adhered to a July ruling from a panel of judges that mandated replacing Habba as the interim U.S. attorney.

title: Henley Leads Tour Championship Opening, Scheffler Close Behind
snippets: Russell Henley hardly missed a putt. Scottie Scheffler hardly missed a fairway. They led a parade of players who seized on the soft conditions at East Lake to begin the race for the Tour Championship and the season-ending FedExCup title.

• Northern Irishman five off lead after opening 66

  • Scheffler hits 63, Fleetwood and MacIntyre 64

More Rory McIlroy drama in ­Georgia. Events at the final hole of the ­opening round of the Tour Championship barely compared with what played out
Scottie Scheffler sits second, two shots off the Tour Championship lead, after a stunning nine-under 61 from Russell Henley in the race for the FedExCup.
titles: Russell Henley fires 61 to lead Scottie Scheffler and field at Tour Championship
McIlroy provides thrills but Henley leads Tour Championship after 61
Scheffler two off Tour Championship lead as Henley cards opening 61
summary: Russell Henley and Scottie Scheffler led the opening round of the Tour Championship, taking advantage of soft conditions at East Lake. Henley leads after a remarkable nine-under 61, with Scheffler two shots behind following a 63. Other notable performances included Fleetwood and MacIntyre each shooting a 64. The event marks the final race for the season-ending FedExCup title, with players like Rory McIlroy also in contention, despite being five shots off the lead after an opening 66.

summary: Israeli troops have started moving towards Gaza City, initiating the "preliminary" phase of a military assault aimed at besieging and occupying the area. This action comes amid warnings from the UN about the potential exacerbation of the humanitarian crisis in Gaza. The operation's current phase focuses on the city's outskirts. Further details and implications of this military action are being closely monitored.

title: Millie Bobby Brown and Jake Bongiovi Adopt Baby Girl
snippets: The Stranger Things star and Jake Bongiovi say they're are "beyond excited to embark on this beautiful next chapter".

Netflix star and model husband Jake Bongiovi, 21 and 23, say they are ‘beyond excited’ to become parents

The Stranger Things actor Millie Bobby Brown and her husband, Jake Bongiovi, have announced they have become parents after adopting a “sweet baby girl”.

Brown, 21, and Bongiovi, 23
"Stranger Things" star Millie Bobby Brown and her husband, Jake Bongiovi, announced they adopted a baby girl. The young couple got married in 2024.
titles: Millie Bobby Brown and husband Jake Bongiovi adopt a baby girl
Stranger Things actor Millie Bobby Brown adopts ‘sweet baby girl’
Millie Bobby Brown and Jake Bongiovi's relationship timeline, from meeting on Instagram to adopting a baby girl
summary: "Stranger Things" actress Millie Bobby Brown and her husband, Jake Bongiovi, have shared their joy in becoming parents after adopting a baby girl. The couple, aged 21 and 23, tied the knot in 2024.

title: Ukrainian Arrested in Italy for 2022 Nord Stream Pipeline Attack
snippets: The Russian-European gas pipeline was the target of a deliberate attack in September 2022.

Serhiy K is believed to have been onboard boat from where 2022 attack on gas pipelines was carried out

A Ukrainian man alleged to have been involved in the 2022 detonation of the Nord Stream pipelines carrying gas from Russia to Germanyhas been arrested in Italy, according to German authori
The suspect is accused of being part of group that placed explosives on the pipelines after hiring a yacht that departed from Germany’s Baltic coast.
titles: Germany: Arrest made over Nord Stream pipeline explosions
Italian police arrest Ukrainian man over Nord Stream pipelines blast
Ukrainian suspect arrested 3 years after alleged Nord Stream pipelines sabotage
summary: A Ukrainian man, Serhii K, has been arrested in Italy for his alleged involvement in the September 2022 attack on the Nord Stream gas pipelines, which transport gas from Russia to Europe. German prosecutors claim he was part of a group that planted explosives on the pipelines, using a sailing yacht hired from Rostock, Germany. This deliberate act targeted the Russian-European gas infrastructure.

title: SEC to Adopt Nine-Game Football Schedule in 2026 for Enhanced Competition
snippets: The SEC said Thursday that it will go with a nine-game conference football schedule starting in 2026.
The development comes on the heels of the College Football Playoff committee updating its metrics
titles: SEC to go with 9-game schedule starting in '26
SEC adopts nine-game conference slate starting in 2026 as CFP metrics shift emphasis on schedule strength
summary: The SEC announced a shift to a nine-game conference football schedule beginning in 2026. This decision follows the College Football Playoff committee's update on metrics. The change aims to enhance competition within the conference.

title: Hurricane Erin Causes Major Flooding in North Carolina, Outer Banks Hit Hard
snippets: The storm flooded parts of North Carolina's Outer Banks, including a section of the main highway. Another round of overwash was happening during the evening's high tide.
Hurricane Erin caused massive coastal flooding in North Carolina on Tuesday as the storm continued its northward march up the East Coast.
titles: Hurricane Erin brings flooding to parts of Outer Banks as it pivots from East Coast
WATCH:  Hurricane Erin brings coastal flooding to North Carolina
summary: Hurricane Erin led to significant coastal flooding in North Carolina, particularly affecting the Outer Banks, where parts of the main highway were submerged. The flooding intensified during the evening's high tide on Tuesday, as the storm progressed northward along the East Coast.

title: Trump's Redistricting Push Sparks Battle Affecting Midterms
snippets: Trump's demand for new district maps in Republican-led states sparked a redistricting fight of the midterm elections.

What's next in the redistricting war after Texas' map cleared the state House - Axios
summary: Donald Trump's call for new district maps in Republican-led states has escalated into a significant redistricting battle impacting the midterm elections. This move has led to a contentious debate over the drawing of district boundaries, with implications for future electoral contests. The current status of this redistricting fight remains a key issue as states navigate the legal and political challenges involved.

title: Lil Nas X Arrested, Hospitalized After LA Altercation with Police
snippets:
The 26-year-old rapper and singer was seen walking down the street in his underwear Thursday morning in LA

Lil Nas X has been arrested and briefly hospitalized after an altercation with police in the early hours of Thursday morning, according to authorities in Los Angeles.

.
The rapper was hospitalized after his arrest and is expected to be charged with misdemeanor battery on a police officer, NBC Los Angeles reported.
titles: Lil Nas X arrested and hospitalized after altercation with police
Lil Nas X Reportedly Arrested Following LAPD Altercation, Possible Drug Overdose
summary: Lil Nas X, a 26-year-old rapper and singer, was arrested and briefly hospitalized following an altercation with police in Los Angeles early Thursday morning. He was seen walking down the street in his underwear before the incident. Authorities expect to charge him with misdemeanor battery on a police officer, as reported by NBC Los Angeles.

title: Israel Expands Gaza Military Operation Amid Cease-Fire Talks, UN Criticism
snippets: The planned offensive has drawn condemnation from the United Nations, which warned it would lead to the forced displacement of about a million Palestinians.
The Israeli government is widening its operation in Gaza despite its generals’ advice and as it deliberates on a new cease-fire proposal.
titles: Israel pounds neighborhoods as operation to take Gaza City underway
Israel Is Expanding Its Gaza City Operation, but Where Does It Stand?
summary: The Israeli government is expanding its military operation in Gaza, ignoring the advice of its generals and while considering a new cease-fire proposal. This move has been condemned by the United Nations, which has warned that it could result in the forced displacement of approximately one million Palestinians.

title: Cox, Curran Propel Invincibles to Win Over Rockets in The Hundred Clash
snippets: Spectacular fifties from Jordan Cox and Sam Cox fire Oval Invincibles to a thrilling six-wicket victory over Trent Rockets in a table-topping clash in the Hundred.

A remarkable 10-ball hitting barrage from Sam Curran and Jordan Cox turned the game on its head and drove Oval Invincibles towards a crucial win against table-topping rivals Trent Rockets in The Hundred.
titles: Cox and Curran blast Invincibles to staggering win
Curran and Cox drive Invincibles to crucial win over Rockets
summary: Jordan Cox and Sam Curran's explosive batting performances, including a 10-ball hitting spree, propelled Oval Invincibles to a six-wicket win over Trent Rockets in a critical match of The Hundred. This victory came in a high-stakes clash between table leaders, with both Cox and Curran playing pivotal roles in turning the game in favor of the Invincibles.

title: Sean Strickland Suspended 6 Months for Fighter Altercation
snippets: Strickland can reduce his suspension by taking an anger management course
Former 185-pound champion Sean Strickland has received a six-month ban from the Nevada State Athletic Commission for a physical altercation with another fighter at an event in June.
titles: Sean Strickland suspended six months after attacking fighter in post-fight brawl while serving as cornerman
Sean Strickland suspended six months for altercation with another fighter
summary: Former 185-pound champion Sean Strickland has been suspended for six months by the Nevada State Athletic Commission due to a physical altercation with another fighter in June. Strickland has the option to reduce his suspension by completing an anger management course.

title: US Open: Sinner, Sabalenka to Face Kopriva, Masarova in Openers
snippets:
• Men’s champion Sinner opens against No 87 Vit Kopriva

  • Women’s title holder Sabalenka draws Rebeka Masarova

British stars Emma Raducanu and Jack Draper will both play qualifiers in their opening matches at this year's US Open.
titles: US Open draw: Emma Raducanu faces tough route if she can beat qualifier in first round
Raducanu and Draper to play qualifiers in US Open first round
summary: At the US Open, men's champion Sinner will start against the 87th-ranked Vit Kopriva, while women's champion Sabalenka faces Rebeka Masarova in their opening matches. British players Emma Raducanu and Jack Draper are set to play against qualifiers in their first rounds. Raducanu, avoiding top seeds early on, still anticipates a challenging path ahead in the tournament.

title: Leah Williamson to Miss WSL Start Due to Injury
snippets:
• England captain sustained injury in final of Euro 2025

  • Defender likely to be sidelined for several weeks

Arsenal have been dealt a blow before the start of the new Women’s Super League season with Leah Williamson ruled out for several weeks after a procedure
England captain Leah Williamson will miss the start of the new Women's Super League season with a knee injury.
titles: Leah Williamson to miss start of Arsenal’s WSL season due to knee injury
England captain Williamson to miss start of WSL season with knee injury
summary: England captain and Arsenal defender Leah Williamson is set to miss the beginning of the Women's Super League season due to a knee injury sustained during the Euro 2025 final. She is expected to be sidelined for several weeks, impacting her club's start to the season.

title: Premier Health Files Q3 2025 Financials, Advances Strategic Transformation

MONTRÉAL, Aug. 21, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) — Premier Health of America Inc. (TSXV: PHA) (the “Company”), a leading Canadian Healthtech company, announces it has filed its unaudited Quarterly Consolidated Financial Statements and MD&A for its third quarter ended on June 30, 2025. Highlights (

summary: Premier Health of America Inc., a Canadian Healthtech company, has filed its unaudited Quarterly Consolidated Financial Statements and MD&A for the third quarter ending June 30, 2025. This follows the completion of the CC Capital transaction, marking a significant step in the company's strategic transformation. The update was announced on August 21, 2025, but details on the financial outcomes or the specifics of the strategic transformation were not disclosed.
